channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023080940
item.description:
Report X-2023080940

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was in our sort when It was called out to our team. Once this package went down the slide to get loaded in a trailer the manager called over our QA team to get it into our hazmat cage for processing. DescribePack: lid was unscrewed. Please apply tape over lids. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA took this package into the hazmat cage and started working on the damaged package.

item.title: Report X-2023081052
item.description:
Report X-2023081052

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER CONSULTED THE UPS DECISION TREE AND DONNED ALL PPE. THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND ALL DEBRIS WERE TAKEN TO THE DMP AREA. ALL CONTAMINATED ITEMS WERE DISPOSED OF FOLLOWING UPS DISPOSAL PROCEDURES.
